 De: Pavly Nashed (Khoros Marketing) <support@khoros-marketing.kayako.com>
Fecha: jueves, 27 de noviembre de 2025, 15:18
Para: Heredia, Erika [C] <erika.heredia@merck.com>
CC: Aamir Merchant <aamir.merchant@ignitetech.com>, Brad Gerard <brad.gerard@ignitetech.ai>, Gonzalez Zambrano, Briamel [C] <briamel.gonzalez.zambrano@msd.com>
Asunto: Re: URGENT: Khoros Marketing Login issue

EXTERNAL EMAIL– Use caution with any links or file attachments. 

 Dear Briamel, 

 Thank you for sharing the screenshot. The message you see in Spanish, “No se puede acceder a este sitio web – ERR_CONNECTION_RESET”, is a generic Chrome network error. It does not come from Khoros itself; it means that something on the way between your browser and login.app.khoros.com is closing or interrupting the connection before it can be established—typically a local firewall, security software, VPN/proxy configuration, or a browser extension. 

 The fact that you can access Khoros Marketing in an incognito window on the same computer confirms that your Khoros account and our platform are working correctly, and that the problem is specific to your standard browser profile. In most cases this is caused by cached data or an extension/security control that only runs in normal mode. In most cases, this can be resolved by refreshing the page or navigating to the URL in a new tab. Alternatively, please try the following: 

 	* Clear cookies and cached data only for login.app.khoros.com and *.khoros.com, then retry.
	* Temporarily disable browser extensions (especially VPN, security, or corporate plug‑ins) and test again.
	* If the error persists, please share this information and the screenshot with your local IT team so they can check any MSD Spain firewall or proxy rules that might be resetting the connection to login.app.khoros.com.

Apart from this temporarily network issue, in case you encounter any issues again logging in to Marketing, please try to log in to Care before logging in to Marketing. We are looking into this further on our end, as we do not have direct access to reproduce the issue on our side, and will work on a permanent fix. 

 Should logging in to Care first does not resolve the issue, please reach out to us, we have a temporary workaround in place that should solve this until the permanent issue is fixed. 

Best regards,
Pavly Nashed
Khoros Marketing Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you. 

 Sent with Kayako [https://kayako.com]

Para: Heredia, Erika [C] <erika.heredia@merck.com>
CC: Aamir Merchant <aamir.merchant@ignitetech.com>, Brad Gerard <brad.gerard@ignitetech.ai>, Gonzalez Zambrano, Briamel [C] <briamel.gonzalez.zambrano@msd.com>
Asunto: Re: URGENT: Khoros Marketing Login issue

EXTERNAL EMAIL– Use caution with any links or file attachments. 

 Dear Briamel, 

 Thank you for your update and the provided details. We sincerely apologize for the experience you had when attempting to raise a ticket. 

 In the meantime, the best way to do this would be to access the support portal (https://khoros-care.kayako.com/ or https://khoros-marketing.kayako.com/ [https://khoros-marketing.kayako.com/%20]) outside of your corporate network/browser to be able to see the Chat option. 

 That being said, based on your detailed explanation, I have a theory on what might have caused this, so let's test it: 

 	* I have made a tiny change on our side now for your account. I believe if you try to log in to Marketing now, it should work.
	* If logging to Marketing works now, please log out. Then, log in to Care, and log out.
	* Attempt to log in to Marketing again, it should fail again.

 Please let me know once you complete the above. I will do a temporary fix again to allow you to log in to Marketing again, and we will work on a permanent fix for this. The results of the above test will confirm the theory. 

 I remain at your disposal. 

Best regards,
Pavly Nashed
Khoros Marketing Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.

Kayako - ticket id 60250271 // Pavly Nashed commented publicly: Dear Erika,

Thank you for reaching out and reporting this.

I can confirm that the issue was previously resolved under case #60237228, and there have been no changes on the Khoros side, nor on Merck/MSD’s access configuration, since that resolution.

Could you please check whether any changes were made on Briamel’s side? For example, switching networks, using a different browser, or adjusting any local system settings.

Based on the history of the previous tickets, Briamel also gained access to Care, but this should not impact their login unless they are attempting to use SSO or using the wrong login URL. The correct URL remains:
https://login.app.khoros.com/user/login?forceLogin=true

To be clear: we did not apply any fix on our end during the last incident. The issue was resolved solely due to adjustments made by Briamel on their side, likely including network-related changes.

At this point, we need more information about any recent modifications on their environment so we can proceed with deeper investigation. Reviewing the current behavior, it appears identical to what we saw before the previous fix—meaning Briamel may need to reapply the same changes that resolved the issue previously.

Please provide details on any updates or changes made on their side since the last resolution.

Best regards,
Pavly Nashed
Khoros Marketing Support Team

This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with "This ticket can be closed" or update the status to Completed in the portal. We will write to you again to remind you.
